On Aug 5, 2010, at 5:51 PM, Eric J. Bowman wrote:

> This may mean
> constraining PUT to only have replacement semantics -- both creation
> and replacement semantics are allowed by HTTP, but a REST API must
> choose one or the other.

That seems to be your misunderstanding. PUT is what HTTP defines it to be. Hypermedia specification can not and need not re-define HTTP semantics.

(That is the reason why you have to provide the information about leap-year or not in the representation, using standardized representation semantics. And that in turn is why re-use is facilitated by REST).

Jan
